intro: Anthemis freitagii, commonly known as the Freitag's fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers with a distinctive central disk, typical of the genus Anthemis. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
